tasks.name: Add Agent Status section
tasks.notes: Enhanced existing Section 5: fixed task counting bug (was double-counting from tasks[] + completed_tasks[]), added expandable per-agent task detail with status badges and notes, added 'active' status color, added BULLETIN recent completions expander, moved import re to top of file, added error handling around heartbeat reads.

tasks.name: Add trading track section
tasks.notes: Added Section 5 (Trading Research) between Video Pipeline and Agent Orchestration. Shows: agent task progress bar, latest agent notes, backtest result cards (return%, drawdown, trades, final value), returns comparison bar chart (Plotly), expandable trade log with color-coded BUY/SELL, expandable research task detail, and watchlist extracted from config.py. All data from trading/results/*.json and agents/trading/state.json.

tasks.name: Add AWS cert progress section
tasks.notes: Added Section 6 (AWS Certification Progress) between Trading Research and Agent Orchestration. Shows: CLF-C02 exam info cards (65 Qs, 700/1000 pass, $100), 4 domain study progress cards with weights and notes/practice-Q completion status, overall study notes progress bar, practice questions status, study files inventory, study agent task progress bar with expandable task detail.

tasks.name: Improve cost charts
tasks.notes: Expanded Cost Tracker from 2 charts to 6 visualizations in 3 rows: (1) Daily spend bar chart with daily budget threshold line + cumulative spend trend line with monthly budget line, (2) Queries by tool pie chart + cost by tool bar chart sorted descending, (3) Agent session costs bar chart with per-agent colors and total + budget forecast panel with avg daily spend, projected month-end, budget % used, and visual forecast progress bar.

tasks.name: Add system health indicators
tasks.notes: Added Section 0 (System Health) at top of dashboard. Shows: ComfyUI status with GPU name + VRAM usage bar + OS/Python info from /system_stats, Ollama status with model count + names from /api/tags, disk space for C: drive with color-coded status (green/orange/red) + usage bar. All checks cached 60s via st.cache_data with 2s timeout to avoid blocking page loads.

tasks.name: Mobile-friendly layout
tasks.notes: Injected responsive CSS via st.markdown with media queries. Mobile (<768px): all st.columns stack vertically (flex-wrap + 100% width), reduced block-container padding, larger expander tap targets, charts prevent overflow with max-width + overflow-x. Tablet (769-1024px): columns wrap to 2-per-row (48% width). Sidebar auto-collapses (native Streamlit behavior).

notes: Iteration 1: Enhanced Agent Orchestration section (dash-1). Fixed task counting bug that double-counted completed tasks. Added expandable task detail per agent showing individual task statuses/notes, BULLETIN recent completions, and 'active' status support.

Iteration 2: Added Trading Research section (dash-2). Reads backtest results from trading/results/*.json, shows return/drawdown/trade cards, Plotly comparison chart, trade log, and research task progress from trading agent state.

Iteration 3: Added AWS Certification Progress section (dash-3). Reads aws-cert agent state + study files from knowledge-base/training/aws/clf-c02/. Shows exam info, 4-domain study progress with weights, practice Q status, study agent task detail.

Iteration 4: Improved cost charts (dash-4). Expanded from 2 to 6 visualizations: daily spend + cumulative trend (row 1), queries pie + cost-by-tool bar (row 2), agent session costs + budget forecast (row 3). Added budget threshold lines, month-end projection, and avg daily spend metrics.

Iteration 5: Added system health indicators (dash-5). New Section 0 at dashboard top: ComfyUI status (GPU/VRAM from /system_stats), Ollama status (models from /api/tags), disk space (C: drive usage). Cached 60s with 2s timeout. Color-coded status badges.

Iteration 6: Added mobile-friendly layout (dash-6). Responsive CSS media queries: mobile stacks all columns vertically, tablet wraps to 2-per-row, reduced padding, larger tap targets for expanders, chart overflow protection.
